intro: Hieracium westooi, commonly known as the Western marsh hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium westooi is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in areas with partial to full sunlight.
